sub_title: PhD Student - University of Birmingham, UK | Marketing Specialist - Pivot Services
summary:
My PhD research looks at possible connections between language attitudes, home language environment and academic achievement in d/Deaf/Hard of Hearing mainstreamed high school students. 

Visit my project website: http://languageattitudesmatter.com for more information. I'm recruiting D/HH mainstreamed high school students from the US to participate in my study!

projects.title: Open Learning to Sign Language
projects.description: Open Learning to Sign Language (OPEN) project is European educational project dedicated to D/deaf people and hearing people. The aim is to improve situations of D/deaf people in the world by giving them full access to language education (other sign languages and English language) in order to foster contact with cultural diversity, eliminate communication barriers and thus improve mobility in the world as well as communication with foreigners.

profile_positions.title: Marketing Specialist

profile_positions.description: In this volunteer position, I coordinated the content of the Delft Mama blog to include more information useful to expat families living in the Delft area. I took suggestions for topics from the community, recruited writers, and managed a team of proofreaders to ensure that all content is ready for publication.
profile_positions.title: Digital Content Coordinator of the Delft Mama Blog

profile_positions.description: I developed a copywriting style guide in collaboration with the marketing team of a technical startup that served as the foundation for all of the company's communications. I also edited company content before it was published online or in print form.
profile_positions.title: Copy editor

profile_positions.description: Working closely with the engineers, I mapped out the content and created an initial draft of the User Manual and Quick Start Guide for the VSParticle Generator One and edited content for publication on the company website. I also worked in a team to gather the necessary documentation to ensure that the machinery complied with EU policies as it was being prepared for the market.
profile_positions.title: Technical Writer

profile_positions.description: I provided individualized online EFL courses tailored to the needs of deaf people.
profile_positions.title: EFL Instructor

profile_positions.description:
Groves Educational Services was a one-woman business with the goal of providing consultation and teaching services in Europe.

My responsibilities included:
Developing individualized English courses for adult Deaf people;
Providing consultation on language education projects; and
Teaching professional development courses in EFL instruction for Deaf students.
profile_positions.title: Researcher, Teacher

profile_positions.description: Consulted and oversaw the development of the educational content of the learning platform, from storyboards to video production and teaching activities. Documented the process in the form of project reports and dissemination activities aimed at stakeholders in Italy.
profile_positions.title: Scientific Consultant
